changes: <?json version 1?>

a1_overview: labels. Replaced generic 'Option 1'/'Option 2' labels with the exact survey answer text for A1 (1 = 'As an adjunct to diet, alone or in combination with other LDL-C-lowering therapies, in adults with primary hyperlipidemia'; 2 = 'As an adjunct to diet and statin therapy for the treatment of adults with primary hyperlipidemia'). No structural changes made.
a3_therapies: Pass through. Labels match survey question A3 (mean number out of last 100 patients for each therapy); structure (mean_rows) is appropriate for numeric-range responses.

a3a_mean_rows: Pass through. Labels already match survey A3a (products × 'In addition to statin' vs 'Without a statin'); structure appropriate for mean_rows of percentage values. No NET/T2B or splits required.
a3b_mean: Pass through. Labels and structure align with survey A3b; added required schema fields (isNet, netComponents, indent, questionId placeholder) and preserved original variable names.

{"tableId":"a4_last100","action":"labels","description":"Corrected table title to match survey A4: this question asks about the NEXT 100 patients (was incorrectly labeled 'LAST 100'). Row labels already match the survey/datamap; no structural changes, splits, NETs, or T2B rows added."}

{"tableId":"a4_next100","action":"passthrough","description":"Pass through. Table structure and labels match survey question A4 (NEXT 100 patients, mean number per 100). No analytical splits, NETs, or T2B applicable. Added required row metadata fields (isNet, netComponents, indent) to meet output spec."}

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><change><tableId>a4a_mean_rows</tableId><action>labels</action><description>Updated row labels to match survey wording for A4a: expanded product names to match survey text (e.g., "Zetia (ezetimibe) or generic ezetimibe", "Nexletol (bempedoic acid) or Nexlizet (bempedoic acid and ezetimibe)") and standardized statin-condition descriptors to 'In addition to statin' and 'Without a statin'. Variables unchanged.</description></change>

{"tableId":"a4b_mean_all","action":"labels","description":"Updated row labels to match survey A4b wording: col1 = 'Before any other lipid‑lowering therapy (first line)', col2 = 'After trying another lipid‑lowering therapy'. Used full survey product names (Leqvio, Praluent, Repatha, Zetia, Nexletol/Nexlizet). No structural changes made."}
Table a6_rank1: passthrough. Labels match survey A6 and the table correctly represents frequency of items ranked #1; no changes required.
{"tableId":"a6_rank2","action":"passthrough","description":"Pass through. Labels match survey text and structure appropriate for ranking question A6; no changes required."}
a6_rank3: passthrough. Labels and structure match survey A6 (ranking question for next 100 patients not on lipid-lowering therapy). No label, NET, T2B, split, or exclusion changes required.
a6_rank4: passthrough. Labels match the survey wording for A6 rank items and the structure is appropriate for a 'ranked #4 (least likely)' frequency table. No NETs, splits or T2B required.
a7: passthrough. Labels match survey A7 and map to binary_flag variables A7r1–A7r5; structure appropriate for a select-all-that-apply question. No NET row added to avoid inventing new variables.

tableId: a8_r1, action: labels. Updated generic numeric labels to survey text for A8 (1=Not at all likely; 2=Slightly likely; 3=Somewhat likely; 4=Very likely; 5=Extremely likely). Reason: clarify category labels so analysts don't need to cross-reference the questionnaire.

tableId: a8_r1_t2b, action: t2b. Added a derived table (sourceTableId = a8_r1) with Top-2-Box ('Likely (T2B)' = 4,5) and Bottom-2-Box ('Unlikely (B2B)' = 1,2) rollups for each product while keeping full-scale detail rows (indented). Reason: standard T2B/B2B summaries are analytically useful for 5-point likelihood scales.

{"tableId":"a8_r2","action":"labels","description":"Replaced generic product labels with survey scale text for A8 row 2: 1=Not at all likely; 2=Slightly likely; 3=Somewhat likely; 4=Very likely; 5=Extremely likely. Variable names unchanged."}

{"tableId":"a8_r2_t2b","action":"t2b","description":"Added a derived table (sourceTableId=a8_r2) with Top 2 Box (4,5) labelled 'Likely (T2B)' and Bottom 2 Box (1,2) labelled 'Unlikely (B2B)'. Included full scale items indented under the NET rows for analyst convenience."}
{"tableId":"a8_r3","action":"labels","description":"Updated labels to match survey A8 scale: 1=Not at all likely; 2=Slightly likely; 3=Somewhat likely; 4=Very likely; 5=Extremely likely."}

{"tableId":"a8_r3_t2b","action":"t2b","description":"Added Likely (T2B) (4,5) and Unlikely (B2B) (1,2) NET rows for each product (Repatha=A8r3c1, Praluent=A8r3c2, Leqvio=A8r3c3). Kept full 5-point scale detail rows. Source table: a8_r3."}
a8_r4: Labels. Updated numeric value labels for A8r4c1/A8r4c2/A8r4c3 to match survey A8 scale (1 = Not at all likely; 2 = Slightly likely; 3 = Somewhat likely; 4 = Very likely; 5 = Extremely likely).

a8_r4_t2b: T2B/Nets (derived). Created a derived view from a8_r4 adding 'Likely (T2B)' (4,5) and 'Unlikely (B2B)' (1,2) NET rows for each product while retaining the full 5-point scale detail rows. sourceTableId = a8_r4.
